Split model into compact residues after removing low confidence residues.
Maximum domains to obtain. You can use this to merge the closest domains at the end of splitting the model. Make it bigger (and optionally make domain_size smaller) to get more domains.
Approximate size of domains to be found (A units). This is the resolution that will be used to make a domain map. If you are getting too many domains, try making domain_size bigger (maximum is 70 A).
Minimum length of a domain to keep (reject at end if smaller). No. of residues.

Minimum length of a short segment to keep (reject at end ).
Used to choose whether the sequence of a removed segment is written to the remainder sequence file.

If low-confidence residues are removed, the cutoff is defined by minimum_lddt or maximum_rmsd, whichever is defined (you cannot define both). A minimum lddt of 0.70 corresponds to a maximum rmsd of 1.5. Minimum lddt values are fractional or not depending on the value of input_lddt_is_fractional.

If low-confidence residues are removed, the cutoff is defined by minimum_lddt or maximum_rmsd, whichever is defined (you cannot define both). A minimum lddt of 0.70 corresponds to a maximum rmsd of 1.5. Minimum lddt values are fractional or not depending on the value of input_lddt_is_fractional.
If set, subtract the lowest B-value from all B-values just before writing out the final files. Does not affect the cutoff for removing low-confidence residues.
Adjust the edge weighting for each residue pair according to the distance between CA residues. If this is True, then distance_model must be provided. See also distance_power
If weight_by_ca_ca_distance is True, then edge weights will be multiplied by 1/distance**distance_power.

If PAE matrix (predicted alignment error matrix) is supplied, each edge in the graph will be weighted proportional to (1/ pae**pae_power). Use this to try and get the number of domains that you want (try 1, 0.5, 1.5, 2)
If PAE matrix (predicted alignment error matrix) is supplied, graph edges will only be created for residue pairs with pae is less than pae_cutoff

If PAE matrix (predicted alignment error matrix) is supplied, pae_graph_resolution regulates how aggressively the clustering algorithm is. Smaller values lead to larger clusters. Value should be larger than zero, and values larger than 5 are unlikely to be useful
